byline.contributor: Omar Al-Jawoshy and Falih Hassan contributed reporting.

abstract: Sunni Iraqis fleeing onslaught by Islamic State forces in Ramadi and elsewhere are finding doors closed to them by their Shiite countrymen; of three million Iraqis displaced by conflict, some 85 percent are Sunni; Shiite authorities have treated displaced as security threats rather than civilians, closing bridges and imposing strict sponsorship rules that few can pass; observers say policy has worsened sectarian tensions and squandered political opportunity for reconciliation.
lead_paragraph: Many Iraqi Shiites are looking with distrust at Sunni civilians displaced by attacks by Sunni militants in the Islamic State.

headline.main: Sunnis Fleeing ISIS Find Few Doors Open Elsewhere in Iraq
headline.print_headline: Sunnis Fleeing ISIS Find Few Doors Are Open Elsewhere in Iraq

snippet: Many Iraqi Shiites are looking with distrust at Sunni civilians displaced by attacks by Sunni militants in the Islamic State.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
